mainEntity.name: What is the GitHub Hot Repo Discovery Tool?

acceptedAnswer.text: The GitHub Hot Repo Discovery Tool is an efficient tool designed to help developers, researchers, and product managers find popular and relevant GitHub repositories. It allows users to search, collect, and analyze projects based on keywords, sorting rules (like stars, forks, updates), and filtering conditions.

mainEntity.name: How do I use the GitHub Hot Repo Discovery Tool?

acceptedAnswer.text: 1. Enter Keywords: Input one or more keywords to search for repositories by name, description, README, or topics. 2. Set Filters & Sort: Choose sorting options (e.g., by stars, forks, last update) and specify the number of results you want. 3. Analyze Results: Review the extracted information for each repository, including its description, stars, forks, language, and license. 4. Export Data (Optional): Save the search results as a CSV file for further analysis.

mainEntity.name: What are the main features of the GitHub Hot Repo Discovery Tool?

acceptedAnswer.text: Key features include: keyword-based search across multiple repository attributes, flexible sorting options, control over the number of results, comprehensive data extraction (name, URL, description, stars, forks, language, update/creation time, topics, license), and CSV export functionality.

This tool is for software developers looking for libraries/frameworks, researchers tracking tech trends, product managers conducting tech evaluations, technical writers seeking projects to document, and anyone interested in discovering interesting or impactful open-source projects on GitHub.

mainEntity.name: Do I need a GitHub API Token to use this tool?

acceptedAnswer.text: While the tool can perform basic searches without a token, configuring a GitHub Personal Access Token (PAT) is recommended to increase the API rate limits, allowing for more extensive searches and a smoother experience, especially for frequent users or large queries.
